entry.title: NEWS.am digest: Diplomatic forum in Antalya kicks off, Karabakh residents have no gas for 4th day

media:group.media:title: NEWS.am digest: Diplomatic forum in Antalya kicks off, Karabakh residents have no gas for 4th day
media:group.media:description:
Armenian News - NEWS.am presents the daily digest of top news as of 11.03.22:
ANTALYA FORUM https://news.am/eng/news/690788.html The Antalya diplomatic forum is in full swing in Turkey. Global leaders, including NATO Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg, came to Turkey on Friday. The dialogue forum, which will convene under the theme “Recoding Diplomacy,” comes at a critical time, in the aftermath of the first meeting between the FMs of Russia and Ukraine. Armenian FM Ararat Mirzoyan is also there. During the meeting on the margins of the Antalya Forum, Armenian FM met his Russian counterpart Sergey Lavrov. Mirzoyan briefed Lavrov on the continuous violations of the ceasefire and provocative actions by the Azerbaijani Armed Forces in Karabakh and on the Armenian-Azerbaijani border. The Armenian FM also noted the importance of taking necessary steps to ease tensions and prevent incidents.
SITUATION IN KARABAKH https://news.am/eng/news/690835.html https://news.am/eng/news/690860.html https://news.am/eng/news/690912.html The situation in Nagorno-Karabakh and on Armenian-Azerbaijani border remains unstable as the Azerbaijani armed forces continue to violate the ceasefire. After firing in Khramort village of Karabakh, today they opened fire from a grenade launcher at the school area of the village of Khnapat in the Askeran region of Artsakh (Nagorno-Karabakh). Moreover, Artsakh residents have had no natural gas supplies since Tuesday after it had been damaged in the area controlled by Azerbaijan. The Azerbaijani army is obstructing access to the accident site of this natural gas pipeline and carrying out repair work there.
PUTIN AND LUKASHENKO https://news.am/eng/news/690913.html https://news.am/eng/news/690917.html https://news.am/eng/news/690921.html Russian president Vladimir Putin said there are some positive developments in the talks between Russia and Ukraine, which are held almost daily. His remarks came during a face-to-face meeting with his Belarusian counterpart Alexander Lukashenko. In turn, President of Belarus Alexander Lukashenko said that all Western sanctions against Minsk and Moscow are illegitimate, and called it "disgusting.”
HELP TO UKRAINE https://news.am/eng/news/690918.html NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg said that the alliance will not send troops and aircraft to Ukraine. Stotenberg told Reuters in an interview that it was important to find a political, diplomatic solution to the current situation. NATO Secretary General reiterated that the alliance will not send troops and aircraft to Ukraine, the agency said in a statement.
FACEBOOK AND INSTAGRAM https://news.am/eng/news/690888.html Facebook and Instagram parent company Meta made some temporary changes to its hate speech policy. From now on, Facebook and Instagram users in some countries will be allowed to call for violence against Russians and Russian soldiers after Putin announced the military operation.
EXPORTS From March 15 to August 31, 2022, Russia may ban the export of grain to the Euraisan Union (EAEU) member states and the export of sugar outside the union. According to the source, this issue was reportedly considered on Thursday at a meeting of the subcommittee on customs-tariff and non-tariff regulation. The corresponding proposals were made by the Ministry of Agriculture.
DOLLAR https://news.am/eng/news/690743.html Dollar rate is still rising in Armenia. The dollar’s (USD) exchange rate against the dram (AMD) is now AMD 518.28/$1 in Armenia on Friday; this is up by AMD 2.27 from Thursday. The exchange rate for one euro was AMD 569.07 (down by AMD 0.35) while the rate of one Russian ruble made up AMD 4.55 (up by AMD 0.18) in the country.
US AID https://news.am/eng/news/690903.html The US House of Representatives on Thursday passed an Omnibus Appropriations Bill wrapping up Fiscal Year 2022 spending that calls for "not less than" $45 million for Armenia and $2 million for humanitarian demining in Artsakh (Nagorno-Karabakh), the Armenian Assembly of America reported. The measure also requires "that prior to any initial obligation of funds appropriated under title IV of the Act for assistance for Armenia and Azerbaijan, the Secretary of State shall consult with the Committees on Appropriations on the proposed uses of such funds."
ARMS PRODUCTION https://news.am/eng/news/690804.html Armenian President-elect Vahagn Khachaturyan said there are companies in Armenia that manufacture armaments and military UAVs. "The most important thing is that they are completely local, in terms of technology, the quality meets the highest standards. The demands of a state and army that went through war are very strict. And is because of the demands that there were delays to some extent," he said. Khachaturyan also noted that Armenia manufactures a large number of weapons.
